1.name: It Came from Outer Space
1.description: A spaceship from another world crashes in the Arizona desert and only an amateur stargazer and a schoolteacher suspect alien influence when the local townsfolk begin to act strangely.

2.name: Young Bess
2.description: The early life of Elizabeth I, from her childhood until her accession to the throne of England in 1558.

3.name: The War of the Worlds
3.description: A small town in California is attacked by Martians, beginning a worldwide invasion.

4.name: Roman Holiday
4.description: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.

5.name: Peter Pan
5.description: Wendy and her brothers are whisked away to the magical world of Neverland with the hero of their stories, Peter Pan.

6.name: Shane
6.description: A weary gunfighter attempts to settle down with a homestead family, but a smoldering settler/rancher conflict forces him to act.

7.name: The French Line
7.description: When her fiancé leaves her, an oil heiress takes a cruise incognito in order to find a man who will love her for herself and not for her money.

8.name: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
8.description: Marjorie Winfield's engagement to Bill Sherman, who has just arrived home from fighting in World War I, serves as the backdrop for the trials and tribulations of her family.

9.name: From Here to Eternity
9.description: In Hawaii in 1941, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing on his unit's team, while his captain's wife and second-in-command are falling in love.

10.name: Stalag 17
10.description: When two escaping American World War II prisoners are killed, the German P.O.W. camp barracks black marketeer, J.J. Sefton, is suspected of being an informer.

12.name: The Hitch-Hiker
12.description: Two fishermen pick up a psychotic escaped convict who tells them that he intends to murder them when the ride is over.

13.name: House of Wax
13.description: An associate burns down a wax museum with the owner inside, but he survives only to become vengeful and murderous.

14.name: How to Marry a Millionaire
14.description: Three women set out to find eligible millionaires to marry, but find true love in the process.

15.name: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
15.description: Showgirls Lorelei Lee and Dorothy Shaw travel to Paris, pursued by a private detective hired by the suspicious father of Lorelei's fiancé, as well as a rich, enamored old man and many other doting admirers.

16.name: Tôkyô monogatari
16.description: An old couple visit their children and grandchildren in the city; but the children have little time for them.

17.name: Le salaire de la peur
17.description: In a decrepit South American village, four men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.

18.name: Hondo
18.description: Army despatch rider Hondo Lane discovers a woman and young son living in the midst of warring Apaches and becomes their protector.

19.name: Niagara
19.description: As two couples are visiting Niagara Falls, tensions between one wife and her husband reach the level of murder.

20.name: The Wild One
20.description: Two rival motorcycle gangs terrorize a small town after one of their leaders is thrown in jail.

21.name: Stazione Termini
21.description: Prior to leaving by train for Paris, a married American woman tries to break off her affair with a young Italian in Rome's Stazione Termini.

22.name: The Big Heat
22.description: Tough cop Dave Bannion takes on a politically powerful crime syndicate.

23.name: Ugetsu monogatari
23.description: A tale of ambition, family, love, and war set in the midst of the Japanese Civil Wars of the sixteenth century.

24.name: Vicki
24.description: The untimely murder of a New York glamor-girl sparks an investigation with an emotionally driven detective at the helm.

25.name: Glen or Glenda
25.description: A psychiatrist tells two stories: one of a transvestite (Glen or Glenda), the other of a pseudohermaphrodite (Alan or Anne).

26.name: Gunsmoke
26.description: A young gunslinger tries to help a rancher and his daughter save their land and cattle from an evil, wealthy land owner.

27.name: Fear and Desire
27.description: Four soldiers trapped behind enemy lines must confront their fears and desires.

28.name: Sommaren med Monika
28.description: A pair of teenagers meet one summer day, start a reckless affair and abandon their families to be with one another.

29.name: Julius Caesar
29.description: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus. Cassius persuades him to participate in his plot to assassinate Caesar, but they have both sorely underestimated Mark Antony.

30.name: Kiss Me Kate
30.description: An ex-husband and wife team star in a musical version of 'The Taming of the Shrew'; off-stage, the production is troublesome with ex-lovers' quarrels and a gangster looking for some money owed to them.

31.name: The Robe
31.description: In the Roman province of Judea during the 1st century, Roman tribune Marcellus Gallio is ordered to crucify Jesus of Nazareth but is tormented by his guilty conscience afterwards.

32.name: Invaders from Mars
32.description: A young boy learns that space aliens are taking over the minds of earthlings.

33.name: Pickup on South Street
33.description: A pickpocket unwittingly lifts a message destined for enemy agents and becomes a target for a Communist spy ring.

34.name: The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms
34.description: A ferocious dinosaur awakened by an Arctic atomic test terrorizes the North Atlantic and, ultimately, New York City.

35.name: I Confess
35.description: A priest, who comes under suspicion for murder, cannot clear his name without breaking the seal of the confessional.

36.name: Calamity Jane
36.description: The story of Calamity Jane, her saloon, and her romance with Wild Bill Hickok.

37.name: Titanic
37.description: An unhappily married couple struggle to deal with their problems while on board the ill-fated ship.

38.name: Beat the Devil
38.description: On their way to Africa are a group of rogues who hope to get rich there, and a seemingly innocent British couple. They meet and things happen...

39.name: Mogambo
39.description: On a Kenyan safari, white hunter Victor Marswell has a love triangle with seductive American socialite Eloise Kelly and anthropologist Donald Nordley's cheating wife Linda.

40.name: The Bigamist
40.description: A man secretly married to two women feels the pressure of his deceit.

41.name: Les vacances de Monsieur Hulot
41.description: Monsieur Hulot comes to a beachside hotel for a vacation, where he accidentally (but good-naturedly) causes havoc.

42.name: Gun Fury
42.description: In Arizona, Frank Slayton's gang robs a stagecoach and kidnaps Ben Warren's fiancée, prompting Warren to pursue Slayton.

43.name: The Band Wagon
43.description: A pretentiously artistic director is hired for a new Broadway musical and changes it beyond recognition.

44.name: The Redhead from Wyoming
44.description: In Wyoming, Sweetwater town sheriff Stan Blaine finds himself in the middle of a range war between greedy cattle barons and newcomer settlers who compete for public lands and unbranded stray cattle.

45.name: Conquest of Cochise
45.description: A cavalry officer tries to keep a lid on a volatile situation when Indian leader Cochise is being prodded into starting a war.

46.name: I vitelloni
46.description: A character study of five young men at crucial turning points in their lives in a small town in Italy.

47.name: The Naked Spur
47.description: A bounty hunter trying to bring a murderer to justice is forced to accept the help of two less-than-trustworthy strangers.

48.name: Tumbleweed
48.description: When a wagon train is wiped-out by the Yaqui Indians, the surviving guide Jim Harvey is accused of desertion and cowardice but Jim escapes the town jail in search of the truth.

49.name: Column South
49.description: Before the Civil War, Lt. Jed Sayre's efforts to conciliate the cavalry and the Navajo are undermined by his racist C.O. and Confederate sympathizers.

50.name: Angel Face
50.description: Ambulance driver Frank Jessup is ensnared in the schemes of the sensuous but dangerous Diane Tremayne.
